    Class Triangulation

    public class Triangulation

    Methods

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    triangulate(List<Vector2>, List<List<Vector2>>, Single, out List<Int32>, out List<Vector3>)

    Perform triangulation for a custom (polygon) mesh.

    Declaration
    public static bool triangulate(List<Vector2> points, List<List<Vector2>> holes, float vertexY, out List<int> outIndices, out List<Vector3> outVertices)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    List<UnityEngine.Vector2> points

    Vector2 List containing all the input vertices of the (polygon) mesh that the triangulation is performed on.
    List<List<UnityEngine.Vector2>> holes

    List of Vector2 List containing all the input vertex list representing holes in the input (polygon) mesh.
    Single vertexY

    The input (polygon) mesh is created in 2D along the x- and z-dimension in the 3D space. This int parameter provides an option to set the polygon's y-dimension value.
    List<Int32> outIndices

    Int List representing all indexes of the successful triangulation process.
    List<UnityEngine.Vector3> outVertices

    Vector3 List representing all 3D vertices of the successful triangulation process.
    Returns
    Type Description
    Boolean

    boolean value indicating whether the triangulation was successful (true) or not (false) (note: error list not implemented yet, therefore the function always returns true by default in this implementation).
